Let me take a stab at it. What are you trying to kill?
What comand sequence did you try to use?
If you do umount it, you'll have to use the force option
When I kill a process, I use the following sequence: ps -fu <my username> | grep <name of the process I'm trying to kill.
Then look for the PID of the process you want and kill that number.
What you might actually want to do is use the mount command to see all the mounted deives.
Identify the device path of your cdrom drive and use THAT path to forcefully umount it.
Like I said, you will need to FORCE it. Type man umount to see what the option is for forcing.
Try looking up the device path instead.
Type mount to see a list of everything that's currently mounted.
I think you're stuck. If I were you, I'd just wait for your iso to finish, if it can.
